skills.name: Identify whether two shapes are similar or not

explanations.A: If two objects are 'similar' they have the same shape. Can a circle be enlarged or shrunk to make any other circle?
explanations.B: If two triangles are 'similar' then corresponding angles are equal. Are all corresponding angles equal in different equilateral triangles?
explanations.C: If two objects are 'similar' then corresponding angles are equal. Not all rhombuses have the same corresponding angles.
explanations.D: If two objects are 'similar' then corresponding angles are equal and one shape is an enlargement of the other. Is this true for regular decagons?

explanations.A: If two objects are 'similar' then corresponding angles are equal and one shape is an enlargement of the other. Is this true for regular pentagons?
explanations.B: If two objects are 'similar' then one is an enlargement of the other. A rectangle cannot be enlarged or shrunk to make all other rectangles.
explanations.C: If two objects are 'similar' they have the same shape. Can a square be enlarged or shrunk to make any other square?
explanations.D: If two objects are 'similar' they have the same shape. Can a circle be enlarged or shrunk to make any other circle?
